title: Olivier Giroud: I don’t always understand Arsene Wenger’s tactical decisions
text:
Arsene Wenger has come under fire for his tactical choices. (Getty Images) Olivier Giroud admits he does not always understand Arsene Wenger’s tactical choices at Arsenal.
The Gunners boss made the controversial decision to drop Alexis Sanchez for Saturday’s 3-1 defeat against Liverpool, only to bring the Chilean on at half-time after a woeful opening 45 minutes at Anfield.
Giroud, meanwhile, revealed to RMC Sport that he was given a two-week break in order to rest an ankle injury which has been hampering him for months.
‘I had discussions with the coach and of course I prefer to be on the pitch,’ Giroud said before Arsenal’s defeat to Liverpool.
‘The coach makes tactical choices, of course, I do not always understand them.
Giroud has been forced to rest due to an ankle problem. (AFP/Getty Images) ‘But it’s also about being a competitor. We must always question ourselves.
‘Do not be happy not to play, that’s normal. Otherwise, it would mean that I have nothing to do with it.
‘I always want to bounce back. And when the coach called on me, I showed him by being decisive when I came in.’
Giroud wants Wenger to stay at Arsenal. (Getty Images) More: Football How does Conte's start at Chelsea compare to Mourinho's?

Wenger is yet to decide his future with his contract due to expire at the end of the season, but Giroud hopes the 67-year-old will remain at the club.
‘I hope that the coach will stay because I am convinced that we do not miss many things in order to win the Premier League,’ said the striker.
‘He is someone who has built this club where it is today. He’s made it one of the best clubs in Europe.
‘I can understand [the anger from fans], but since I arrived at Arsenal we have been constantly on the rise.’
